tool.name: Plot MDS
tool.description: Create a multidimensional scaling plot to identify outliers in samples

param.name: countPath
param.label: Counts Data
param.help: No data? See help section below!

param.name: factData
param.label: Factor Levels
param.help: In order matching the columns of the counts matrix: ie WT,WT,Mut,Mut,Mut,WT...

param.name: labelData
param.label: Sample Labels
param.help: In order matching the columns of the counts matrix: ie Smpl1,Smpl2,Mut-Smpl1,Mut-Smpl2,Mut-Smpl3,Smpl3...

param.name: labelSize
param.label: Plot Labels Size
param.help: Reduce if labels are overlapping or running off plot

tool.help:
.. class:: warningmark
The input must be in tabular format, if your input does not appear in the drop down menu then check the format in the history panel.
**Counts Data**
A matrix of expression level with rows corresponding to particular genes and columns corresponding to the feature count in particular samples. Values must be tab separated and there must be a row for the sample/column labels and a column for the row/gene labels.::
"Smpl1" "Smpl2" "Smpl3" "Smpl4" "Smpl5" "27395" 1699 1528 1463 1441 1495 "18777" 1905 1744 1345 1291 1346 "150370" 6 8 4 5 5 "21399" 2099 1974 1574 1519 1654 "58175" 356 312 347 361 346 "108664" 2528 2438 1762 1942 2027 "12421" 2182 2005 1786 1799 1858 "240690" 3 4 2 3 3 "319263" 1337 1380 1004 1102 1000 "71096" 0 0 2 1 6 "59014" 1466 1426 1296 1097 1175 ...
NOTE: The column labels look misaligned with the columns due to the presence of row labels, this is read correctly into R which proccesses the data.
**Factor Levels**
The levels of your samples seperated by comma, no spaces should be present and the order of the levels must correspond to the column order of the samples in the input matrix. This input determines the colour of the plot where the samples of the same level are given the same colour.
**Sample Labels**
The labels to the samples provided seperated by comma, no spaces should be present and the order of the labels should reflect the column order of the samples in the input matrix. This input determines the label plotted on to the MDS plot and the point corresponding to each sample will be that sample's label.
**Label Size**
Scale factor for the size of labels, if the labels are too long in the standard plot then this value should be reduced, if more visibility is desired then this value can be increased. The scaling value is bounded between 0 and 2.
